arguments.response_text:
I was adopted when I was two years old, so learning my Swedish heritage was very important to me.
Didn't know who I was, didn't know why I was the way I was, didn't know why I was so quiet in front of strangers,
had that personal space, didn't know where my place was in the world.
Turns out I'm a Viking. Turns out I'm very Swedish, and when I found everything about Sweden,
Swedishness, and everything revolving it, I found my place, and it became very special to me,
and this trip is a very, very special trip to me, and I'm soaking in every minute,
and I'm thankful that it exists, so thank you.
arguments.response_summary: The text describes someone's journey of discovering their Swedish heritage and feeling a sense of belonging.
arguments.matched_prompt: How did you and your family build a life in Chicago?
